info.title: MemOS Dashboard APIs
info.description: Dashboard API for managing messages and searching memories in MemOS.

post.description: This API allows you to add one or more messages to a specific conversation. As illustrated in the examples bellow, you can add messages in real time during a user-assistant interaction, import historical messages in bulk, or enrich the conversation with user preferences and behavior data. All added messages are transformed into memories by MemOS, enabling their retrieval in future conversations to support chat history management, user behavior tracking, and personalized interactions.

messages.content: I want to travel during summer vacation, can you recommend something?
Sure! Are you traveling alone, with family or with friends?
I'm bringing my kid. My family always travels together.
Got it, so you're traveling with your children as a family, right?
Yes, with both kids and elderly, we usually travel as a whole family.
Understood, I'll recommend destinations suitable for family trips.

post.description: This API retrieves the historical conversation records between a user and the assistant for a specified session, with the option to limit the number of results. As shown in the examples bellow, you can use the returned recent messages as references for the model when generating responses, maintaining dialogue coherence and contextual understanding. It can also be used to restore chat context when a user refreshes or reopens the app, ensuring a seamless user experience and supporting personalized interactions.

This API allows you to query a user’s memory and returns the fragments most relevant to the input. These can serve as references for the model when generating responses. As shown in the examples bellow, You can retrieve memory in real time during a user’s conversation with the AI, or perform a global search across their entire memory to create user profiles or support personalized recommendations, improving both dialogue coherence and personalization.

In the latest update, in addition to “Fact Memory”, the system now supports “Preference Memory”, enabling LLM to respond in a way that better understands the user.

example.query: Any suggestions for where to go during National Day?
What fun places are in Shanghai?

post.description: This API is used to delete specified user memories, supporting batch deletion.
This API is used to add feedback to current session messages, allowing MemOS to correct memories based on user feedback.
Get the status of an asynchronous processing task.
Create a knowledgebase associated with the project.
Delete a knowledgebase from the current project. To permanently delete it, please operate from the Console - Knowledgebase page.
Upload a document to a specified knowledgebase.
Get information about a specified document.
Delete a document from a specified knowledgebase.

TokenAuth.name: Authorization
TokenAuth.description: Token API_key, available in API Console > API Keys

user_id.title: User ID
user_id.description: Unique identifier of the user associated with the conversation.

conversation_id.title: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: Unique identifier of the conversation. Providing this clarifies the current session, prioritizing its memory over historical sessions. If omitted, cross-session memory retrieval is performed for more relevant responses.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Filter conditions, used to precisely limit the memory scope before retrieval. Available fields include: "agent_id", "app_id", "create_time", "update_time", and specific fields in "info". Supports logical operators (and, or) and comparison operators (gte, lte, gt, lt). For the "info" field, supports filtering by "business_type", "biz_id", "scene", and other custom fields.

knowledgebase_ids.title: Knowledgebase IDs
knowledgebase_ids.description: Selected scope of knowledgebases for retrieval.

memory_limit_number.title: Memory Limit Number
memory_limit_number.description: Limits the number of returned fact memories, controlling the count of recalled fact memories. Default: 6, Max: 25.

include_preference.title: Include Preference
include_preference.description: Whether to recall preference memories. When enabled, the system intelligently recalls memories related to user preferences based on the query. Default = true.

preference_limit_number.title: Preference Limit Number
preference_limit_number.description: Limits the number of returned preference memories, controlling the count of recalled preference memories. Effective only when include_preference=true. Default: 6, Max: 25.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: Indicates the maximum number of generated tokens.

add_message_on_answer.title: Add Message On Answer
add_message_on_answer.description: Whether to automatically write user and assistant conversation content into memory. When enabled, developers do not need to call the add/message API to add messages as memory.

app_id.title: App ID
app_id.description: Unique identifier of the application associated with the conversation.

agent_id.title: Agent ID
agent_id.description: Unique identifier of the Agent associated with the conversation.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: List of custom tags used to mark the topic or category of the conversation.

info.title: Info
info.description: Custom metadata field capable of storing any structured data related to the conversation, such as location, source, version, etc., primarily for precise filtering or source tracking during retrieval.

allow_public.title: Allow Public
allow_public.description: Whether to allow adding to public memory.

allow_knowledgebase_ids.title: Allow Knowledgebase IDs
allow_knowledgebase_ids.description: List of knowledgebases where memories generated from added messages are allowed to be written.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code List for details.

event.description: Stream event name, currently defaults to message.

type.description:
Stream message type, used to identify the semantic category of the current data.
reasoning: Reasoning content
text: Normal text content
end: End of stream indicator

user_id.title: User ID
user_id.description: Unique identifier of the user associated with the message.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: Array of message objects representing the memory content. The total token limit for the message array is 8k. Each object contains:

agent_id.description: Unique identifier of the Agent associated with the added message, primarily used to query exclusive memories between a user and that Agent during retrieval.

app_id.description: Unique identifier of the App associated with the added message, primarily used to query exclusive memories of a user under that App during retrieval.

tags.description: List of custom tags used to mark the topic or category of the added message.

info.description: Custom metadata field capable of storing any structured data related to the added message, such as location, source, version, etc., primarily for precise filtering or source tracking during retrieval.

allow_public.description: Whether memories generated from the added message are allowed to be written to the public memory store. When enabled, generated memories can be retrieved by other users in the project.

allow_knowledgebase_ids.description: Scope of knowledgebases where memories generated from the added message are allowed to be written.

async_mode.description: Whether to enable asynchronous memory addition. When enabled, memory will be added asynchronously in the background to avoid blocking the call chain.

chat_time.title: Chat Time
chat_time.description: Time of the conversation, as a structured timestamp or Chinese text. Providing this parameter allows memory to include time information.

text.description: Text message content. Required when type is text.

url.description: Image message URL. Required when type is image_url.

file_data.description: Accessible file URL or base64. Supports txt / pdf / doc / docx. Single file max 100MB, 200 pages, total max 20 files. Required when type is file.

tool_call_id.description: Unique identifier for the tool call message when role is tool.

id.description: Unique identifier for the tool call, used to associate with this tool call. Required in tool_calls.

type.description: Tool call type, currently only supports function. Required in tool_calls.

function.description: Defined tool to be called. Required in tool_calls.

arguments.description: Tool call arguments, must be a JSON formatted string. Required in tool_calls.

tool_calls.description: List of tool call information when role is assistant, used to pass when triggering tool calls.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details

message.title: Message
message.description: API response message, e.g., "Message added successfully".

success.title: Success
success.description: Indicates if the message was added successfully. true = success, false = failure.

task_id.title: Task ID
task_id.description: Unique identifier of the memory processing task.

status.title: Status
status.description: Current status of the memory processing task.

OpenMemAddMessageResponse.title: OpenMemAddMessageResponse
OpenMemAddMessageResponse.description: Object representing the result of adding the message.

user_id.title: User ID
user_id.description: Unique identifier of the user associated with the messages being retrieved.

conversation_id.title: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: Unique identifier of the conversation associated with the messages.

message_limit_number.title: Message Limit Number
message_limit_number.description: Limits the number of messages returned, controlling the length of the message list. Defaults to 6 if not provided. The maximum allowed value is 50.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

message_detail_list.title: Message Detail List
message_detail_list.description: List of retrieved message details. Each item includes:

update_time.title: Update Time
update_time.description: Last update time of the message.

MessageDetail.title: MessageDetail
MessageDetail.description: List of retrieved message details. Each item includes:

user_id.title: User ID
user_id.description: Unique identifier of the user associated with the memory being queried.

conversation_id.title: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: Unique identifier of the conversation containing the memory. Providing this ensures the current conversation’s memories have higher priority over other historical.

query.title: Query
query.description: Text content to search within the memories.The token limit for a single query is 4k.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Filter conditions, used to precisely limit the memory scope before retrieval.Available fields include: "agent_id", "app_id", "create_time", "update_time", and specific fields in "info". Supports logical operators (and, or) and comparison operators (gte, lte, gt, lt). For the "info" field, supports filtering by "business_type", "biz_id", "scene", and other custom fields.

knowledgebase_ids.description: This field is used to restrict the scope of knowledge bases that can be accessed in a single search. It is empty by default and can be used for implementing frontend permission control.

memory_limit_number.title: Memory Limit Number
memory_limit_number.description: Limits the number of fact memory items returned, controlling the length of fact memory. Defaults to 6 if not provided. The maximum allowed value is 25.

include_preference.title: Include Preference
include_preference.description: Whether to enable preference memory recall. When enabled, the system will intelligently retrieve the user’s preference memories based on the query. Defaults to true if not provided.

preference_limit_number.title: Preference Limit Number
preference_limit_number.description: Limits the number of preference memory items returned, controlling the length of fact memory. Defaults to 6 if not provided. The maximum allowed value is 25.

include_tool_memory.title: Include Tool Memory
include_tool_memory.description: Whether to enable tool memory recall. When enabled, the system will intelligently retrieve tool-related memories based on the query. Default is false if not provided.

tool_memory_limit_number.title: Tool Memroy Limit Number
tool_memory_limit_number.description: Limits the number of tool memory items returned, controlling the count of recalled tool memories. Effective only when include_tool_memory=true. Default is 6 if not provided, max is 25.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

memory_detail_list.title: Memory Detail List
memory_detail_list.description: List of memory fragment details returned. Each item includes:

preference_detail_list.title: Preference Detail List
preference_detail_list.description: List of preference memory details returned. Each item includes:

tool_memory_detail_list.title: Tool Memory Detail List
tool_memory_detail_list.description: List of tool memory fragment details returned.

preference_note.title: Preference Note
preference_note.description: Preference memory usage note when it is retrieved.

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique identifier of fact memory, used internally by the system.

memory_key.title: Memory Key
memory_key.description: Title or keyword summarizing fact memory.

memory_type.title: Memory Type
memory_type.description:
WorkingMemory: short-term working memory, temporarily stored.
LongTermMemory: long-term memory, important information or facts stored persistently.
UserMemory: user-specific memory, personalized information related to a specific user.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: Creation time of fact memory, usually in ISO 8601 format.

conversation_id.title: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: Unique identifier of the conversation associated with fact memory.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Fact memory status. All retrieved fact memories are currently activated.
activated: active fact memory, available for retrieval and use.

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description:
Confidence score of fact memory, ranging from 0 to 1. Values closer to 1 indicate higher reliability.
The score may gradually decay over time or with repeated model reasoning to reflect uncertainty.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: List of tags associated with fact memory for categorization or retrieval. Each element is a string, e.g., ["person", "event", "work"].

update_time.title: Update Time
update_time.description: Last modification or update time of fact memory, usually in ISO 8601 format.

relativity.title: Relativity
relativity.description: Relevance score of fact memory to the query, ranging from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate stronger relevance.

MemoryDetail.title: MemoryDetail
MemoryDetail.description: List of memory fragment details returned. Each item includes:

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique identifier of preference memory, used internally by the system.

preference_type.title: Preference Type
preference_type.description:
explicit_preference: Explicit preference memory.
implicit_preference: Implicit preference memory.

reasoning.title: Reasoning
reasoning.description: The reason why preference memory was extracted.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: Creation time of preference memory, usually in ISO 8601 format.

conversation_id.title: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: Unique identifier of the conversation associated with preference memory.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Preference memory status. All retrieved preference memories are currently activated.
activated: active preference memory, available for retrieval and use.

update_time.title: Update Time
update_time.description: Last modification or update time of preference memory, usually in ISO 8601 format.

experience.title: Experience
experience.description: Tool usage experience or collaboration suggestions.

success_rate.title: Success Rate
success_rate.description: Success rate of this tool trajectory.

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique identifier of the tool memory fragment.

tool_type.title: Tool Type
tool_type.description: Tool memory type. ToolTrajectoryMemory: tool trajectory memory; ToolSchema: tool info memory.

tool_value.title: Tool Value
tool_value.description: Specific content of the tool memory.

tool_used_status.title: Tool Used Status
tool_used_status.description: List of tool trajectory memories, each record contains tool used and experience info.

conversation_id.title: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: Unique identifier of the conversation associated with the tool memory.

update_time.title: Update Time
update_time.description: Last update time of the tool memory (ISO 8601 format).

user_ids.title: User IDs
user_ids.description: List of users whose memories can be deleted.

memory_ids.title: Memory IDs
memory_ids.description: Unique identifiers of the memories to be deleted.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether deletion was successful. true for success, false for failure.

user_id.title: User ID
user_id.description: Unique identifier of the user associated with the feedback content.

conversation_id.title: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: Unique identifier of the conversation associated with the feedback content.

agent_id.title: Agent ID
agent_id.description: Unique identifier of the Agent associated with the feedback content, primarily used to query exclusive memories between a user and that Agent during retrieval.

app_id.title: App ID
app_id.description: Unique identifier of the App associated with the feedback content, primarily used to query exclusive memories of a user under that App during retrieval.

feedback_time.title: Feedback Time
feedback_time.description: Time when the feedback occurred, can be a structured timestamp or natural language time description. Providing this parameter allows memory to include time information.

allow_public.title: Allow Public
allow_public.description: Whether memories generated from the feedback content are allowed to be written to the public memory store. When enabled, generated memories can be retrieved by other users in the project.

allow_knowledgebase_ids.title: Allow Knowledgebase IDs
allow_knowledgebase_ids.description: List of knowledgebases where memories generated from the feedback content are allowed to be written.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether addition was successful. true for success, false for failure.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

status.title: Status
status.description: Current status of the memory processing task.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

id.title: KNOWLEDGEBASE ID
id.description: Knowledgebase ID returned after successful creation

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether removal was successful. true for success, false for failure.

content.title: Content
content.description: Document content, supports URL or Base64

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

file_ids.title: File IDs
file_ids.description: List of document IDs to delete

code.title: Code
code.description: API status code. See Error Code for details.

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether deletion was successful. true for success, false for failure.
